resources.string: Technical support request from EnDOtec EASYselector App

It is usual that an observed worn part involves the combination of several individual wear mechanisms. Simple solutions become insuficient and the practical solution lies with experience a broad product range and partnership.

 THIS IS A TRUE CASTOLIN EUTECTIC COMPETENCE

 This makes the wear mechanism considerably more complex and difficult to understand. Sometimes 2, 3 or even 4 different wear mechanisms can be operating, which render the simple solutions insufficient. However, the primary wear mechanism must be established.

 How to use this app:
 1. Analyse and identify the primary wear factor involved.
 2. Analyse and identify the secondary and tertiary wear factors.
 3. Use this guide to have a first selection of the Endotec wires oriented to your application requirements.

 If needed consult your technical department for confirmation and further help in welding procedure.
Plug of Atox Mill. Cement industry.Base metal: unalloyed steel Dimensions: 140mm (inside) x 155mm (length)
Exchangeable solution. The shells can be turn 90º after wearing so at least 4 times longer lifetime
Air guiding ring of a Vertical Roller Mill. Cement industry Base metal: structural steel (S355JRG2) Dimensions: 520x350 mm
2,5 times better service lifetime and easy assembling and disassembling of wear protection plates
Separator blades in cement industry Base metal: low alloyed hardening steel (16MnCr5) Dimensions: 1940x180 mm
Increasing lifetime, from 730 days with previous solution to 1095 days with current solution
Fan blade of a primary air blower, in cement industry.Base metal: structural steel Dimensions: Ø1600x120mm
Reducing welding time (around 65%) . Increasing life time up to 3 times
Roller of a refuse disposal boiler in thermal power plant. Base metal: structural steel. Dimensions: Ø=400mm L=1200mm
Erosion / abrasion at low preasure, especially in flanges
Increasing lifetime more that 5 times compared to Hardox
Concrete pump pipe. Base metal:structural steel
Erosion and abrasion inside the pipe
Kiln tyre of a cement kiln Base metal: low alloy cast steel (GS 30 Mn 5). Dimensions: Ø 6500x1400x500mm Chamfer dimensions: 1200x170x250mm
Mechanical fatigue due to extreme working conditions
Faster application with this wire and absence of slag
Longer life time, less risks of cracking (hydrogen cracks or residual stress in the HAZ)
Longer life time, less risks of cracking (hydrogen cracks or residual stress in the HAZ)
Longer life time, less risks of cracking (hydrogen cracks or residual stress in the HAZ)
Good weldabilty, excellent mechanical properties and high deposition rate
Good weldabilty, excellent mechanical properties and high deposition rate
Good weldabilty, excellent mechanical properties and high deposition rate
Pelton buckets of Pelton turbine in a hydroelectrical power plant. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel (410 NiMo).
Severe cavitation and erosion because of suspension solids in the water used to move the buckets.
Longer service life and higher equipment efficiency. Cavitec has the best comparison results to any other alloy.
Inlet parts of a refiner cycrotube in pulp and paper industry. Base metal: austenitic stainless steel Dimensions: 300x500mm
Longer service lifetime, at least 3 years
Blades of water propeller of a water treatment plant. Base metal: cast iron
Cavitation and erosion because of water with suspension solids
Life time increased up to 4 times
Rotor of a circulation pump in a thermal power plant. Base metal: high alloyed cast steel (GX 10 Cr 13/GX 12 Cr14).
Increasing service lifetime. Very long, not finish yet.
Increasing service lifetime. Very long, not finish yet.
Hydropulper rotor for pulp and paper industry. Base metal: AISI 316. Dimensions: Ø1500mm
Severe wear due to the water with pulp and some other materials.
Service lifetime : 4–5 months and quicker repair
Forming Tool of a a Hydraulic press Base metal: duplex steel
Due to high pressure and adhesion the tool for producing fittings shows high wear
Insensitive to adhesive wear even in the absence of lubrication - low coefficient of friction with metallic friction.
Chisel of a roll stand for steel rail production Base metal: Unalloyed heat treatable steel
High pressure and temperature (up to 1100ºC) cause wear in the chisels due to high friction
Smoother surface of the chisels Longer lifetime up to 3 times Less shrinking of the surface
Stop of a lathe. Cold working tool steel Base metal: NC6, NC11
Friction and impacts caused by the rings during loading. Uneven contact surface causes vibrations that reduce the loss of required dimension
Looping rolls of wire drawing and rolling Base metal: Austenitic manganese steel
Friction at high temperature caused by the rollers which prevent the wire from being tense
Increasing of lifetime from 15 days till 90 days
Drive roller stand. Iron and steel industry. Base metal: F114 Dimensions: Ø337mm x 710mm
Forming tool in a hydraulic press. Forging Base meta: Superduplex
Friction metal to metal due to high pressure of the tool
Less sensitive to wearness even wihtout lubrication
Bar straighening guide Base metal: Structural steel
Friction metal to metal due to the pressure caused from the cylinder to the bars
Increasing of lifetime from 25 days till 35 days
High abrasion with very low impact (almost without impact) due to milling of talc
Extend life up to 2–3 times more (From 2 days up to 9 days)
High abrasion due to ceramic transport (bricks and clay)
Extend life time up to 5–6 times more
Worn screew (minerals). Base metal: low alloy steel, heat treated
High abrasion due to mineral transport (thenardita)
Extend life time up to 4 times more. Inmediate application, avoiding long trip for the new screw and belower price.
Blade of kneading machine (clay). Base metal: low alloy steel
High abrasion due to mix of clay and pyrite
Higher deposit speed, less welding time, less time repair of the kneading machine. Longer life time up to 3 times
Worm screw (sand). Base metal: strengthen low alloy steel
High abrasion combined with high temperature (corrosive environment)
Extend life time from 4 months to 12 months and not necessary to change the endless screw
Worm screw. Base metal : low alloy steel
High abrasion due to transport of cement
Higher abrasion resistance, improving the life time for a very long time
Screw for fuel feeding, wood chips and animal substances. Base metal : low alloy steel
High abrasion due to transport of different elements
Higher abrasion resistance, improving the lifelong time up to 18 months
Biomass transport screew. Base metal: low alloy steel
High abrasion due to transport of bark
Improving the lifelongtime up to 24 months
Roll in cooling area, Steel mill. Base metal: Low alloy steel GS-52
Higher abrasion resistance, improving the life time from 60 to to 180 days
Transport screw (cement). Base metal: low alloy heat treatable steel. Dimensions: Ø=300mm L= 3000mm
High abrasion due to tansport of cement
Significant extension of life time and easy to machine
Roller for grinding of glass recycled. Base metal: low alloy steel (St37)
Very good resistance to high abrasion plus impact, without cracks
Hammer crusher rotor (with swinging hammers). Base metal: low alloy cast hardening steel. Dimensions: Ø=800mm t=80 mm. Weight: 1000kg
High impact and abrasion due to the action between the swinging hammers and the anvil, to chop the metal goods (200–300 g of wear per ton of scrap produced)
Increasing life time (previous: 120 days ; Castolin solution: 210 days)
Cone holder of a crusher for quarrying sand and gravel. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel (Ø110/880x435 mm)
Increasing lifetime, from 365 days with previous solution to 550 days with Castolin solution. Cheaper than changing.
Driving wheel for an excavator in an open cast mining. Base metal: Unalloyed heat treatable steel. Dimensions: Ø2000mm t=450 mm
High impact and abrasion especially on the teeth fo the driving wheel
Increasing life time and better cost/benefit rate. Cheaper than replacement. DO*310 provides homogeneous and crack free deposits
Hammers of a secondary crusher in cement industry. Base metal: Austenitic manganase steel (14%Mn-2%Mo). Dimensions: 420x350x140 mm
Impact and some abrasion because the hammers have to crush the limestone
Increasing service lifetime 50%. 3 years service lifetime
Crusher impeller of impact crusher. Open cast mining. Base metal: structural steel (Ø1000x340mm)
Impact due to reduction of stones from 60mm to 0,5–30mm
Increasing lifetime from 300 days with competitor solution to 600 days with Castolin solution
Elbow´s for waste material in glass industry Base metal: St37
Impact and abrasion due to fall down of refused glass bottles
Decreasing period of time for removing the elbow, excellent weldability and high deposition speed
Bar hammer of a secondary crusher in brick and clay works. Base metal: low alloyed cast hardening steel Dimensions: 510x60x30mm
27 hour of operating time and no need to stop the crusher during shifts. This means 800% increasing lifetime
Hammer of a braking press for manufacture of animal feeds.Base metal: structural steel
Impact under high pression, to reduce the size of animal bones
Similiar lifetime but a much lower price and no rick of spalling
Die of a forging press Base metal: Low alloyed heat tretable steel
Fatigue and friction at high temperature
Deposition time has halved, mechanical properties has improved and die´s life has been extended
Campling jaw of forging machine Base metal: Hot working tool steel (1.2714)
High temperature and impact while the glowing forging is fixed by the jaws
Excellent resistant against heat and impact. Double lifetime compared with the typical solution
Roller continuos casting plant Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel
Hot temperature and pressure of the billet cause rapid wear of the rollers
Anual saving costs, longer lifetime up to 5 times more
Chisel of a rollstand. Iron and steels works. Base metal: unalloyed heattreatable steel. Dimensions: 700x80x80mm
High temperature and pressure because the chisels guide the hot billet (1000ºC) through the right position of the rollstand
3 times longer service lifetime, less shrinkage and better quality of the rails because the smooth surface of the rails
Bottom plate of the coke-cross over machine (iron and stell works) Base Metal: structural steel
Abrasive wear is caused by coke falling onto the bottom plate
Cheaper base metal coated with DO*60. 3 times longer lifetime of these plates
Retort of a roller hardening furnace. Base metal: Ni alloy Dimensions: 3x0,5m
Repair of a crack exposed to thermal fatigue
To avoid replacement of the expensive retort
Blade of rotor cutting alfalfa Base metal: Low alloy heattretable steel (Hardox 400)
The rotor has a spiral with several blades that collect the alfafa leading abrasion wear but also small impacts due to the stones from the ground
2 years in service (double lifetime). Avoid disassembling and changing the blades.
Hammer of a mixer in a compost plant. Base metal: Low alloy heattretable steel (Hardox 400)
Several abrasion and some impacts on the blades that mix the wooden products such as trees, brunches, soil and sand.
Longer life service from 6 to 13 months.
Hammer of a secondary crusher in a cement plant. Base metal: Low alloyed heat treatable steel (38NCD4)
The hammers of the crusher has to crush the limestone into small pieces (20 to 80 mm) so they are subjected to severe abrasion combined with impact.
Double life service compared with the competitor´s application from 180 to 360 days)
Cutting tools - Tires grinding machine Base metal: Unalloyed steel (St37)
Sever abrasion combined with high impact and friction (heat)
The plant can grind close to 1.000 tons each 3 weeks compared with the previous 770 tons each three weeks. Better weldability
Head piece of a tunnel cutter. Base metal: structural steel
Different Impact and abrasion depending on the ground zone worked.
Lifetime increased up to 500 hours. The working time with competitor solution was 300 hours
Hammers of a pendulum mill.Base metal: construction steel
Hammers suffer from abrasion and impact, balanced at 50%
Longer life time, from 5 months up to 30 months
Rotor and cutting tools. Base metal: Heat treatable steel
Abrasion and impact from secondary grinding of Tires (rubber pieces 80mm size)
Life time increase up to 3 times
Screew for ground extraction. Base metal: low alloyed case hardening steel
High abrasion and impact due to ground extraction, mainly in the blades
Cost savings coming from longer life time, possible to do several coatings and cheap base material.
High abrasion due to handle of tree waste
Much better welding job and much lower production cost.
Shaft of a crushing machine for refuse recycling. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel. Weight: 800kg
Abrasion at high pressure and some impacts mainly in the edges of the knives because they have to crush the animal bones
Cheaper repair compared with the substitution of the shaft. Saving more than 300.000€
Cutting blade in a rolling mill Base metal: low alloy heat treated iron (180x105x50mm and 160x97x35mm)
Abrasion and impact due to the pass and cutting of corrugated steel (8–32mm)
High impact combined with moderate abrasion due to the passage of logs
The application was made in 2011. In 2015 still in service without being worn
Drill tip of a drifter por civil engineer. Base metal: Low alloyed heat tretable steel
High impact combined with abrasion due to different grounds. (clay, sand, stones,rock…..)
2 times-3 times longer life and if necessary on site repair at a very high speed.
Upper and lower finishing rollers of a Kieserling polishing machine. Base metal: 42CrMo4
Impact and abrasion because of continuouss pass of 12m bars
Increasing service lifetime up to 2 times
Toggle of a feed hopper in the manufacture of basic chemicals Base metal: S235 Structural steel Dimensions: 1000x630 mm
The toggle suffers from impact and abrasion because the aggregates and blocks of limestone fall down in the hopper from 1m height and evacuates through the chute evacuation.
Grape of crane Base metal: St52
This grape suffers from high impact and abrasion due to the load and unload of the cobble-stones
Increasing the lifetime and easy to weld in position
Crushing teeth in a Waste crusher machine.
Very good weldability, high deposition rate and very low dilution
Break teeth of a mobile shredder. Refuse recycling. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel Dimensions: 300x80mm
High impact and abrasion because the teetht have to crush the scrap
Mixer blades for brick and clay tile production. Base metal: carbon steel
Impact and abrasion while mixing clay
Entrance bars to the cooling bed. Base metal: non-alloyed structural steel (1.0577). Dimensions: 1950x40 mm
Impact and abrasion because of the transport of billet.
Double service lifetime (up to customer´s target: 365 days)
Discs of a primary crusher (cement industry). Base metal: austenitic manganese steel
Service lifetime increase up to 3 times.
Oven outlet closure plate in a cement furnace. Base metal: high alloyed cast steel (GX 40 CrNiSi 25 20). Dimensiones: 500x300x100mm
At least 4 years lifetime. Parts still there
Transport screw for extrusion of polymers with ceramic components. Base metal: Alloyed steel
Longer life time. Up to 3 times compared to DO*06
Transport screw. Iron and steel industry. Base metal: heat resistant steel Dimensions: Ø70x1000mm
High abrasion at high temperature over the whole screw
Higher hardness with just 2 layers, faster and cheaper production. Longer life time.
Chain conveyor in cement industry. Base metal: austenitic manganese steel
Abrasion and heat on the surface of chain
Longer service lifetime, thicker layers possible, better quality
Support plate just before the entrance of box number 2 in railway manufacturing line. Base metal: cast non-alloy steel
High abrasion and firction at high temperature
Still 8 years service with very litle wear.
Mixer arm of a mixer for production of asphalt. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel Dimensions: 750x20x16mm (32 units)
Less arms purchased, reduction costs of the wearing parts and down time reduced
Roller of continuos casting plant. Base metal: low alloyed cast hardening steel. Dimensions: Ø110x530mm
Abrasion at high temperature because these rolls lead the vertical track into the horizontal drawing machine
Cutting blade of crimped wire (from 8 to 32mm). Wire drawing and rolling industry. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel. Dimensions: 180x108x50mm and 160x97x35mm
The cramped wires are cutted at 500–600ºC sot the blades reach around 200ºC. Main wear phenomena: Impact and heat. Others: corrosion, abrasion and thermal fatigue
Lifetime of 4 weeks and faster deposition rate
Punch of a hammer press in hot forge. Base metal: St 52. Dimensions: Ø 200mm
Impact and heat because these punches to produce hot forge flat steel and finally perforate them.
Longer lifetime so the maintenance cost are reduced with no reduction of quality
Bottom plate of a coke-cross over machine. Base metal: structural steel. Dimensions: 960x600x30mm
The hot coke falls on the bottom plate suffering from impact and heat.
Longer lifetime (180 days with Castolin solution) and cheaper base material
52 cooller braker hammers of a clinker machine Base metal: unalloyed cast steel Dimensions: 230x350x160mm
Impact heat because the hammers have to reduce the clinker size.
Ash crusher roll in thermal power plant. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel/cast steel Dimensions: Ø152mm x 2000mm
Impact heat in both rollers and teeth because they have to crush the large lumps of ash.
On-site solution, increasing service lifetime and easy build-up of edges.
Press die of a forging press. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel. Dimensions: Ø300x100
High thermal stress, impact and abrasion
High resistance against friction, deforming and impact. The ductile weld material steady without any tendency for cracking on corners and edges
Break of an automatic lathe. Base metal: Cold working tool steel (NC6, NC11). Dimensions: Ø73 / 180x74mm
Abrasion, impact at high temperature because this part has to support a ring forging during loading and the turning operation
At least 100% increasing lifetime. Castolin lifetime: 42 days
Comb of a chipper from wooden factory. Base metal: St37
High pressure, some impacts and heat because the comb has to reduce the size of the wood into chips
At least four years from Castolin solution and the combs are still in service
High abrasion, medium impact and low heat
Increasing servive lifetime. Possibility to repair and consecuently, cost reduction.
Pusher/centering guide of a roll wagon. Base metal: low alloyed steel Dimensions: 5*50/50*500 mm
Abrasion at high temperature (~ 500ºC) and impact
Crusher shaft of brick crashing machine. Base metal: structural steel Dimensions: Ø350 x450 mm
Abrasion, impact at 40–50ºC because the crusher has to crash the bad quality bricks from production line.
Descaling Ramp in a hot strip rolling mill. Base metal: Low alloyed steel Dimensions: 1350x1500x200mm
Abrasion at high temperature and impact because the slab passes trough the ramp and due to a blasting high pressure water.
Easy welding an repetitive procedure without cracking risk. Increasing life time up to 2 times nowadays. Part still in service.
Discs of a clinker crushing roller in a cement plant. Base metal: Alloyed steel Dimensions: Ø490x150mm
These roller are outside the cooler and they suffer from abrasion, impact and heat at moderate pressure
Handle shield in the middle rows of a hammer mill in a thermal power plant. Base metal : St37–2. Dimensions: 5x50/50x500 mm
Maintenance cost savings because the service life time has been increased 700%
Tromel of a falling clinker between the furnace and the cooler. Base metal: austenitic stainless steel (16Mo3 + inox 304L)
High corrosion and thermal fatigue of metal base and joinings

Good resistance to corrosion, oxidation. Excellent resistance to thermal shocks. Very high impact strength. Low heat input for low dilution. Maximised weld metal recovery. Faster deposition rate for reduced labour costs.
Protecting steel plate of a chute in a waste incineration. Base metal: St 52.3 Canal dimensions: L=3000mm W= 700mm Walls dimensions: L=2600mm H=1000mm
This cobalt alloy layers improve corrosion resistant on that exigent environment
Shaft of a fan in a pulp a paper plant. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel
Highest Protection against corrosion. Customer annual savings close to 400.000€
Worm screw of a plastic injector Base metal: Low alloy cast steel
The reclaiming operation was performed in record time (15 minutes for a screw of 1,600 x 50 mm) The bead and finish aspect are unsurpassable, with less grinding time.
Zinc deposit for galvanization. Base metal: Stainless steel 316L. Dimensions: 2870 x 1161 mm
Corrosion because of zinc inside the deposit
The cracks have not apeared again from first application 8 months ago.
Double-seat valve on a by-pass pipeline of a boiler room. Base metal: Unalloyed cast steel
Worm screw of a pulp and paper press Base metal: structural steel
Both DO*04 and DO*13 ensure high safety against cracks. The lifetime can be increased from 5 weeks up to 25 weeks
Mix and feed screw of wet nickel with lime. Base metal: stainless steel 316L. Dimensions: Ø 320 x 2880 mm
Abrasion and corrosion because of transport and mix of these materials. The damp affects the nickel matrix so sulphuric acids are formed affecting the screw
Increasing lifetime from 3 months (with the previous solution) up to 2 years
Excavator teeth of an excavator ship for quarrying sand and gravel. Base metal: unalloyed cast steel. Dimenions: 100x240 mm
Abrasion and corrosion due to combination of sand and water on the 30 teeth of the drill crown.
Increasing lifetime to 32 hours, so it has increased 8 times.
Nozzle vane feedings of a feeder coal boiler. Base metal: AISI 310 Dimensions: 8mm thickness
Abrasion and corrosion due to continuous pass of heat coal (400–500ºC)
Increasing service lifetime. Up to three times until today. Still in service
Pulper press Base metal: austenitic stainless steel. Dimensions: Ø1000 mm
Sector 5 screw-propeller of a dehydration press of solid urban waste
Abrasion at high pressure plus corrosion
Press fats. Waste recycling Base metal: low alloyed cast steel Dimensions: Ø248mm x 210mm
Abrasion and corrosion because of crashing of animal wastes, mainly in the final part and the edges
Excellent abrasion resistant after 1 layer with 68 HRC. Cheaper solution and longer life, close to 5.000h
Screw of bark storage in manufacture of wood Base metal: unalloyed heat treatable steel. Dimensions: Ø 700 x 9500 mm
Abrasion and corrosion due to the contact with bark and environmental conditions
Better corrosion resistance. Longer time in service
Worm screw of a plastic injector in manufacture of rubber products like soles of shoes. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel. Screw dimensions : 1600x50mm
Abrasion and corrosion at moderate temperature due to injection of rubber
Record time of application and better finish aspect
Screw conveyor feeder to dehydrate the wood shavings. Base metal: authentic stainless steel (AISI 316). Dimensions Ø 120/350 x 2000 mm
Abrasion and corrosion at high pressure
Resistance to pressure, low friction coefficient, mirror finish and deposit with minimum cracking
Pelton buckets of Pelton turbine in a hydroelectric power plant. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel (410 NiMo)
Severe cavitation and erosion because of suspension solids in the water used to move the buckets
Longer service life and higher equipment efficiency. Cavitec has the best comparison results to any other alloy.
Hydropulper rotor for pulp and paper industry. Base metal: AISI 316. Dimensions: Ø1500mm
Severe wear due to the water with pulp and some other materials.
Service lifetime : 4–5 months and quicker repair.
Fan of a circulation pump in a thermal power plant. Base metal: high alloyed cast steel (GX 10 Cr 13/GX 12 Cr14)
Increasing service lifetime. Very long, not finish jet.
Blades of water propeller of a water treatment plant. Base metal: cast iron
Cavitation and erosion because of water with suspension solids
Life time increased up to 4 times
Worm screw. Base metal: CrNi alloy (SMO 254) Dimensions: Ø190x174mm
Abrasion and some impacts in very corrosive atmosphere (gases which contain sulphur acids)
Increasing service lifetime from six month to over 2 years
95 hammers of a primary crusher for waste and recycling.
Abrasion and impact in corrosive environment
Increasing lifetime, up to 22 days. Ecotest available
Rolling guide under the heating oven for iron and steel production. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel (ASTM 140). Dimensions: 20x50x6000mm
Impact abrasion and uniform corrosion because these rolling guides have to support the hot steel bars
Mixing propeller in manufacture of ceramic goods. Base metal: structural steel. Dimensions: Ø 1000 mm
Abrasion and corrosion due to the mixture of clay and sand at high rotational speed
A considerable increase of part life. From 60 days (with previous solution) to 380 days
Circular knife for manufacture of animal feeds. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel
Abrasion impact and corrosion because the knife has to cut the animal bones
Increasing lifetime and posibility of machining
Press die (forging press) Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel. Dimensions: Ø 300mm t=100mm Weight: 25kg
Abrasion with high press. Some impacts and corrosion during working process.
Longer production, less repairs, general cost reduction.
Baffle plate of a steam turbine. Base metal: nickel alloy (Hastelloy C). Dimensions: Ø1500x300mm
Corrosion and heat because the air passing through the intake guides contains H2S
Quicker repair and without any deformation. Increasing of lifetime (50% more)
Protection steel plate of a furnace cooling ring in waste incinerator. Base metal: St 52.3. Dimensions: 670x8mm, development: 6000mm
Corrosion caused by the hot gases, containing aggressive vapours from chlorine and sulphur
Avoid having cracks in the protection plate and resistance to corrosion and abrasion
Roller in continous casting plant. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel. Dimensions: Ø200–400 x 420mm
The hot and oxided billets contact the water cooled drived rollers causing corrosion and heat.
400000 T of production compared with 80000 T of previous solution
Retort of a hardening furnace of casting metals. Base metal: nickel alloy. Dimensions: 4500x1500mm
Saving a lot of money and time because Castolin solution avoid buying a new retort
Transport screw of a feeder of metal goods. Base metal: unalloyed steel/ low alloyed steel (SS 2353/316L). Dimensions: Ø320x2880 mm
The screw mix nickel with lime and transport it to the owen at 450–900ºC so it suffers from corrosion, heat and abrasion.
The lifetime has increased from 3 months up to 2 years
Transport screw of a sand recycler in a waste incineration Base metal: low alloyed hardened steel
Longer lifetime. From 4 months (with the previous solution) to 12 months (3x)
Blade of an ash mixer in a thermal power plant. Base metal: austenitic stainless stell (X2CrNi18–8/X2CrNiMo19–12–3), similar to 308 and 316
Abrasion and corrosion due to the silicum content in ash mixed with water from lignite coal burned
Longer lifetime from 3 months (with previous solution) to 12 months
Blades for oxygenation sludge treatment. Base metal: 20Mn5
Abrasion, corrosion and temperature because the blades move the water
Faster deposition of beads, less time, cost reductions.
Wedge of a safety valve in thermal power plant. Base metal: low alloyed heat treatable steel (P91). Weight: 0,2kg
High press 100 atm.. High temperature 550ºC. Corrosion and wear caused by steam.
Fast and efficient process ensuring high quality deposit and better performance in service.
Furnace outer rolls for continuos cast slab casting. Iron and steel works. Base metal: low alloyed cast steel (21CrMoV5.11) Dimensions: Ø140x900mm
Life extension, reduction of manufacturing costs, repetitive solution. Savings close to 300.000€ per year. Ecotest available.
Forging die. Hammer forging. Base metal: hot working tool steel (1.2714) Dimensiones: 900x500x280 mm
Hard impacts, thermal cycles and shocks in a corrosive ambient. The temperature of the die is around 500ºC. The dies forges boron steel for agriculture

Protective steel plate of a chute in waste incineration Base metal: St 52.3 Dimensions: 3000x700mm and 2000x2600x1000mmProtective steel plate of a chute in waste incineration Base metal: St 52.3 Dimensions: 3000x700mm and 2000x2600x1000mm
Impact heat and corrosion because the waste is shot on the plates of the chute in order to feed the combustion furnace
Wear plates of a cement crusher. Base metal: Austenitic manganese steel (13%Mn 2,25%Cr) Weight: 65kg
Low time to complete the job and excellent results in service
Fuller plate of a clinker cooler. Base metal: austenitic stainless steel Dimensions: 300x417mm
